definitions.definition: An infectious disease of humans and animals caused by a species of mycobacterium , usually Mycobacterium tuberculosis , mainly infecting the lungs where it causes tubercles characterized by the expectoration of mucus and sputum , fever , weight loss, and chest pain, and transmitted through inhalation or ingestion of bacteria .

main_definition: ( pathology ) An infectious disease of humans and animals caused by a species of mycobacterium , usually Mycobacterium tuberculosis , mainly infecting the lungs where it causes tubercles characterized by the expectoration of mucus and sputum , fever , weight loss, and chest pain, and transmitted through inhalation or ingestion of bacteria . [from 1839]
